title: 107_hr4992
content: SEC. 942 of the Public Health Service Act amends Part E of title VII to add a new subpart regarding pharmacist workforce programs, including public service announcements. The Secretary will develop public service announcements to promote the pharmacist profession and encourage individuals to enter the field. These announcements will be broadcast through various media outlets to reach a wide audience. Additionally, grants will be awarded to support State and local advertising campaigns for the same purpose. The grant recipients will use funds to advertise and promote the pharmacist profession, highlight education programs, inform the public about assistance, and recruit new pharmacists from the community. The campaigns to promote the pharmacist profession will be broadcast on various platforms to reach a wide audience and recruit new pharmacists. "SEC. 772. DEMONSTRATION PROJECT." The Secretary will establish a demonstration project to involve pharmacists in the National Health Service Corps Loan Repayment Program. Pharmacists will provide medication therapy management services to ensure proper medication use, enhance patient understanding, improve adherence, reduce adverse events, and lower the need for costly medical services. Services may include case management, disease management, drug therapy management, patient education, counseling, and medication administration. The Secretary will establish a demonstration project involving pharmacists in the National Health Service Corps Loan Repayment Program. Pharmacists will provide medication therapy management services to enhance patient understanding and adherence, reduce adverse events, and lower the need for costly medical services in rural and urban areas. Participants must comply with all requirements and the project will not affect health professional shortage area designations. The Secretary will establish a demonstration project involving pharmacists in the National Health Service Corps Loan Repayment Program. Pharmacists will provide medication therapy management services to enhance patient understanding and adherence, reduce adverse events, and lower the need for costly medical services in rural and urban areas. The project will not affect health professional shortage area designations. The Secretary shall prepare and submit a report on the project to specified committees in the Senate and House of Representatives. The Secretary may award grants or contracts to qualifying schools of pharmacy for computer-based systems to provide pharmaceutical education. These systems can offer graduate, professional, or continuing education on-site or through distance learning. A qualifying school of pharmacy requires students to serve in a clinical rotation with pharmacist services. Authorization of appropriations is provided. Authorization of appropriations is provided for the purpose of carrying out this subpart for fiscal years 2003 through 2006.
